title: Senior solution Engineer
content:
A career at Lilium is for those who want to do something extraordinary. We take pride in pushing the boundaries of engineering, technology and customer experience.  
As part of a team, you will tackle challenges and deliver something that has never been done before. By joining Lilium you will have the opportunity to work with a world-class entrepreneurial team of more than  800 people who are  as passionate about changing the world as you are.  
You will always act with safety and integrity in mind and embody our core behaviors of efficient and positive collaboration, ownership of time, continuous improvements and, ultimately delivering results.
We thrive on diversity and creating an inclusive culture, with more than 50 nationalities currently working hard to bring our vision of a sustainable world to life. Your Role And Your Team  You will be part of the IT DevOps Engineering team and work closely with our Global IT, Engineering and Digital Innovation teams. The DevOps Engineering is a project and service team within the Global IT division. It is responsible for the greenfield design, build, and operational management of highly secure and scalable digital solutions as key enabler of Lilium CTO, and engineering departments.  
A/C test and flight test are critical success factors at the design phase of the Lillium jet, test data management and test management IT solutions are the key enablers.  
DevOps engineering IT team seeks an autonomous and creative IT Solution Engineer, this individual must be a team player who can successfully partner with the flight test, A/C structure testing and A/C system test teams of Lilium. Customer satisfaction and success is imperative for building an IT to business relationship. 
Responsibilities : 
Understand business processes and support the business with relevant technical IT solutions and implementation  
Structure complex requirements along business operations and translate them into IT solutions  
Conduct extensive discovery on business objectives and challenges, use cases, technical architecture/topology  
Evaluate tools and technology for flight test management and flight test data management  
Evaluate tools and technology for all kind of A/C structure and A/C system test management and test data management  
Drive make or buy decisions  
Maintain archiving, security, backup, and redundancy strategies  
Write and maintain custom scripts to increase system efficiency and lower the human intervention time on any tasks  
Provide 1st, 2nd and 3rd level support 
Qualifications  
Strong academic background with at least a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent  
Superior listening, communication, and presentation skills  
Excellent time management and coordination skills within a matrixed organization  
Confident with a sense of pragmatism to deliver results regardless of obstacles  
Strong sense of personal ownership and responsibility in accomplishing the organizational objectives and key results  
Professional experience designing and delivering technology solutions (solutions on a cloud platform a plus)  
Experience with Python, data analytics, and Palantir is a plus  
Ideally, professional experience in the aviation industry  
Knowledge of PLM solutions (like Teamcenter) is beneficial 
 Want to know more? Then view our 'Why join Lilium' page!
Life at Lilium:
The wellbeing of our employees is a high priority. In our HQ we have many initiatives such as free healthy food and drinks, free in-house gym and health days. In remote offices we offer online opportunities to stay connected and develop yourself as well including our culture club, learning terminal, Employee Assistance Program and many more.
 Lilium is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

questions.description:
Lilium Website Privacy Notice

Lilium Recruitment Privacy Notice

** For clarity, to comply with our legal obligations, Lilium will collect, store, and process your data for 6 months for the purpose of considering you for employment.  Additionally, should you provide consent directly below, Lilium will also collect, store, and process your data for up to 730 days thereafter for the purpose of considering you for other opportunities on the Lilium Career Portal.
questions.label: Data Protection Information

values.label: I confirm that I have read and understood the Lilium Website Privacy Notice and the Lilium Recruitment Privacy Notice, regarding the collection, processing and storage of my personal data for the recruitment process.

questions.label: IMPORTANT: I confirm I have submitted my CV in English, and understand that my application will not be reviewed if it is in another language
